371.description: A BILLTo amend sections 4163.01 and 4163.07 and to enact sections 4163.08 and 4163.09 of the Revised Code to require a person shipping certain radioactive material within or through this state to provide the Emergency Management Agency with notice of the shipment and pay the Department of Public Safety a fee for each shipment, and to establish the Radiation Response Fund.

372.title: Corporations-cumulative voting/sale of all assets to wholly owned subsidiary
372.description: To amend sections 1701.04, 1701.24, 1701.55, 1701.58, 1701.591, 1701.69, 1701.70, and 1701.76 of the Revised Code to allow the original articles of incorporation to eliminate cumulative voting in the election of directors, to remove restrictions for certain corporations regarding the elimination of cumulative voting, to exclude from the existing procedures for the sale of all or substantially all of the assets of a corporation the sale of those assets to the corporation's wholly owned subsidiaries, to permit the articles or certain regulations of a corporation to provide for uncertificated shares, and to authorize the directors to amend the articles with respect to series of shares.

373.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
373.title: "Cpl. Joshua Harmon Memorial Highway"- Interstate 90
373.description: To enact section 5533.94 of the Revised Code to designate the portion of Interstate Highway 90 located within the municipal corporation of Willoughby Hills in Lake County as the "Cpl. Joshua Harmon Memorial Highway."

374.title: Indigent defense support fund-create
374.description: To amend sections 2949.091, 2949.111, 4503.13, 4507.45, 4509.101, 4510.22, 4511.19, and 4511.191 and to enact section 120.08 of the Revised Code to create the indigent defense support fund.

375.title: Cable operators-arbitrate disputes with video programming competitors
375.description: To enact section 1332.36 of the Revised Code to require cable operators to participate in arbitration regarding disputes with providers of competing video programming.

376.title: Solid waste facilities in solid waste district- within same district office
376.description: To enact section 3734.511 of the Revised Code to require the Director of Environmental Protection to structure the jurisdiction of the Environmental Protection Agency's district offices so that every solid waste facility in a solid waste management district is within the jurisdiction of the same district office for purposes of administering the law governing solid waste facilities.

377.title: High school curriculum-include study of specified historical documents
377.description: To amend sections 3313.60 and 3313.603 of the Revised Code to require the study of specified historical documents be included in the high school American history and government curriculum.

378.title: Commercial & public entities-maintain records of workers
378.description: To amend section 4113.99 and to enact section 4113.80 of the Revised Code to require a commercial or public entity to maintain records regarding each worker who performs services for that entity and to establish penalties for failure to maintain those records.

379.title: Non-public Ohio universities-collaborate in Ohio Research Scholars Program
379.description: To amend Sections 263.10, 263.20.90, and 375.10 of Am. Sub. H.B. 119 of the 127th General Assembly, to amend Section 235.10.40 of Am. Sub. H.B. 699 of the 126th General Assembly, and to repeal Section 375.20.80 of Am. Sub. H.B. 119 of the 127th General Assembly to increase the funds available for the Ohio Research Scholars Program and to permit a nonpublic four-year Ohio university to submit a proposal for the Ohio Research Scholars Program if the proposal is to be implemented in collaboration with a state college or university.

380.title: Job retention tax credit-expand-businesses headquartered in Ohio
380.description: To amend section 122.171 of the Revised Code to expand the job retention tax credit for eligible businesses with corporate headquarters in this state.

381.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
381.title: "Carl B. Stokes Memorial Highway"-State Route 2
381.description: To enact section 5533.92 of the Revised Code to designate State Route 2 within Cuyahoga County only as the "Carl B. Stokes Memorial Highway."

382.title: Mental health/substance abuse-prohibit discrimination-health insurance
382.description: To amend sections 1739.05, 1751.01, 3923.281, 3923.282, and 3923.51 and to repeal sections 3923.28, 3923.29, and 3923.30 of the Revised Code to prohibit discrimination in health care policies, contracts, and agreements in the coverage provided for the diagnosis and treatment of mental illnesses and substance abuse or addiction conditions.

383.title: Township greenspace-permit recreational use
383.description: To amend section 5705.19 of the Revised Code to permit land acquired by a board of township trustees for the purpose of protecting or preserving "greenspace" to be used for recreational purposes.

384.last_action: To Financial Institutions, Real Estate, & Securities
384.title: Disabled veterans-postpone foreclosures/ veterans-lawsuit for rights-no costs
384.description: To enact section 1349.38 of the Revised Code to prohibit a creditor within eighteen months of the person's release from active duty from initiating a mortgage foreclosure against a person who is a veteran who has made a claim for disability benefits and to forgive Ohio court costs for veterans seeking civil damages in an Ohio court for denial of rights.

385.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
385.title: Bicycle riders under 18-wear helmet
385.description: A BILLTo enact section 4511.531 of the Revised Code to require bicycle operators and passengers under 18 years of age to wear protective helmets when the bicycle is operated on a roadway and to establish the Bicycle Safety Fund to be used by the Department of Public Safety to assist low-income families in the purchase of bicycle helmets.

386.last_action: To Financial Institutions, Real Estate, & Securities
386.title: Surplus delinquent tax collections-use to prevent mortgage foreclosures
386.description: To amend section 321.261 of the Revised Code and to repeal Section 757.30 of Am. Sub. H.B. 119 of the 127th General Assembly to extend to all counties the authority to utilize surplus delinquent tax collections to prevent residential mortgage foreclosures and to facilitate nuisance abatement of deteriorated residential buildings in foreclosure.

387.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
387.title: Speed transition zone-if speed limit decreases 20 mph or more
387.description: To amend section 4511.21 of the Revised Code to require the Director of Transportation or a local authority with jurisdiction over a street or highway to establish speed transition zones at locations where a speed limit decreases by 20 or more miles per hour.

388.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
388.title: Bicycle operation-modify law
388.description: To amend sections 4511.07, 4511.132, 4511.27, 4511.55, and 4511.56 of the Revised Code to revise certain laws as they relate to bicycle operation.

389.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
389.title: Street rod/custom vehicle-historic vehicle/title law-trailers 4,000 lbs & under
389.description: To amend sections 4501.01, 4503.181, and 4505.01 and to enact sections 4505.063, 4505.072, and 4513.051 of the Revised Code to classify street rods and custom vehicles as historical vehicles for motor vehicle registration, certificate of title, and equipment purposes, and to apply the motor vehicle certificate of title law to trailers and semitrailers that weigh 4,000 pounds or less.

390.title: Bureau of Motor Vehicles-establish next of kin database
390.description: To enact section 4501.81 of the Revised Code to establish a next of kin database within the Bureau of Motor Vehicles.

391.title: Restaurants/food retailers-no trans fats
391.description: To amend sections 3717.01 and 3717.05 of the Revised Code to prohibit the use of trans fats by food service operations and certain retail food establishments.

392.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
392.title: LCPL Nicholas B. Erdy/Lance Cpl. Kevin S. Smith-memorial highways
392.description: To enact sections 5533.101 and 5533.791 of the Revised Code to designate a portion of United States Route 50 located in Clermont County the "LCPL Nicholas B. Erdy Memorial Highway" and to designate State Route 334 in Clark County as the "Lance Cpl. Kevin S. Smith Memorial Highway."

393.title: Protection order end-return personalty/social security benefits-divorce exemption
393.description: To amend section 3105.171 of the Revised Code to generally exclude a spouse's social security benefits from a divorce court's jurisdiction.

394.title: Counties-appropriate money to charitable organizations serving community purpose
394.description: To enact section 307.852 of the Revised Code to authorize a board of county commissioners to appropriate funds to tax-exempt 501(c)(3) organizations for the design and construction of a veterans memorial education center and veterans service commission office.

395.title: Workers' Comp-exempt Longshore & Harbor Workers' Compensation Act-covered employees
395.description: To amend section 4123.01 of the Revised Code to exempt individuals covered under the federal Longshore and Harbor Workers' Compensation Act from coverage under Ohio's Workers' Compensation Law unless an employer elects to provide such coverage.

396.title: Radiologist assistants-licensing
396.description: To enact sections 4774.01, 4774.02, 4774.04, 4774.06, 4774.08,  4774.10, and 4774.99 of the Revised Code regarding licensure of radiologist assistants.

397.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
397.title: "Patrolman George Brentar Memorial Highway" -Interstate 90
397.description: To enact section 5533.95 of the Revised Code to designate the portion of Interstate Highway 90 located within the municipal corporation of Euclid in Cuyahoga County as the "Patrolman George Brentar Memorial Highway."

398.title: Railroads-maintain meeting, housing, food service facilities
398.description: To enact section 3733.60 of the Revised Code to require railroad companies to maintain certain meeting, housing, and food service facilities according to certain specifications.

399.title: Property tax-exempt conservation easement property
399.description: To enact section 5713.40 of the Revised Code to partially exempt conservation easement property from taxation.

400.title: Property tax exemption-conservation easement property
400.description: To enact section 5713.40 of the Revised Code to partially exempt conservation easement property from taxation.

401.title: Wild animal collecting-extend duration of permit
401.description: To amend section 1533.08 of the Revised Code to extend the period for which a wild animal collecting permit is valid from one year to three years.

402.title: Viatical settlements-change law
402.description: To amend sections 1321.72, 1321.78, 3916.01 to 3916.03, 3916.05 to 3916.07, 3916.09 to 3916.20, and 3916.99 and to enact sections 3911.021, 3916.031,  3916.171, 3916.172, and 3916.173 of the Revised Code to make changes to the law governing viatical settlements.

403.title: County MR&DD boards-revise service lists
403.description: To amend sections 5126.042 and 5126.055 of the Revised Code to eliminate the requirement that each county board of mental retardation and developmental disabilities maintain a service substitution list and long-term service planning registry and revise the law governing county boards' waiting lists.

404.title: Corporal punishment-prohibit in all public schools
404.description: To amend sections 3314.03, 3319.088, 3319.41, and 3326.11 of the Revised Code to prohibit corporal punishment in all public schools.

405.title: Sales tax-expand natural gas exemption/exempt propane sales
405.description: To amend section 5739.02 of the Revised Code to expand the sales tax exemption for sales of natural gas, and to extend exemption to sales of propane.

406.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
406.title: "The Luke 'Doc' Emch and Matt 'Doc' Conte Corpsmen Memorial Highway"-Interstate 76
406.description: To enact section 5533.091 of the Revised Code to designate that part of Interstate 76 within Brimfield Township, in Portage County, as "The Luke 'Doc' Emch and Matt 'Doc' Conte Corpsmen Memorial Highway."

407.title: Commercial drivers license test-administer in English
407.description: To amend section 2903.06 and to enact section 4506.091 of the Revised Code to require that commercial driver's license tests be given in English and to provide that the penalty enhancement for aggravated vehicular homicide, vehicular homicide, and vehicular manslaughter for driving under a license suspension and the requirement for a mandatory prison term in certain cases of aggravated vehicular homicide and vehicular homicide for driving under suspension also apply to driving under cancellation and driving without a license.

408.title: Sickle Cell Anemia Advisory Committee-create
408.description: To enact section 3701.136 of the Revised Code to create the Sickle Cell Anemia Advisory Committee.

409.title: "Omega Psi Phi Month"-November
409.description: To enact section 5.2236 of the Revised Code to designate the month of November as "Omega Psi Phi Month."

410.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
410.title: "Sickle Cell Anemia Awareness" license plates
410.description: To amend section 4501.21 and to enact section 4503.496 of the Revised Code to create "Sickle Cell Anemia Awareness" license plates.

411.title: Death-registered nurses determine/pronounce
411.description: To amend sections 2105.35, 2108.07, and 2108.30 of the Revised Code to authorize registered nurses to determine and pronounce death.

412.title: Violence against family/household-modify when offender must personally appear
412.description: To amend section 2919.251 of the Revised Code to modify when a defendant who is accused of committing an offense of violence against a family or household member must personally appear for the setting of bail.

413.title: Animal fighting (including cockfighting & dogfighting) increase penalty
413.description: To amend section 959.99 of the Revised Code to increase the penalty for animal fighting, including cockfighting.

414.title: Great Lakes-St. Lawrence River Basin Water Resources Compact-ratify
414.description: To enact sections 1522.01, 1522.02, 1522.03, 1522.04, 1522.05, 1522.06,  1522.07, and 1522.08  of the Revised Code to ratify the Great Lakes-St. Lawrence River Basin Water Resources Compact and to establish related requirements.

415.title: "Ronald Reagan Day"-February 6
415.description: To enact section 5.2238 of the Revised Code to designate February 6 as "Ronald Reagan Day."

416.title: Cruelty to animals-revise penalties/protection orders-include companion animals
416.description: To amend sections 959.99, 2152.19, 2903.213, 2903.214, 2919.26, 3113.31, 4732.141, and 4757.33 and to enact section 4731.284 of the Revised Code to revise the penalties and sentencing provisions regarding violations of the cruelty to animals statutes and to include the protection of companion animals in temporary protection orders, domestic violence protection orders, anti-stalking protection orders, and related protection orders.

417.title: Intimidation of homeless persons-a crime
417.description: To enact section 2927.121 of the Revised Code to create the offense of intimidation of a homeless person.

418.title: State spending-collect relevant information & publish on-line
418.description: To enact sections 126.51, 126.52, 126.53, 126.55, 126.57, 126.61, and 126.62  of the Revised Code to promote transparency with respect to state spending by requiring that certain information on state awards and earmarks, state real property management, state agency management, and state program effectiveness be collected and made available on-line.

419.title: Nuisance property near schools-civil action to eradicate
419.description: To enact sections 3318.81, 3318.811, 3318.812, and 3318.813 of the Revised Code to eradicate nuisance properties from around schools.

420.title: Water Resources and Economic Development Study Committee
420.description: To create the Water Resources and Economic Development Study Committee.

421.title: Stipends for board-certified teachers; teacher wage differentials
421.description: To amend sections 3319.55, 4117.08, and 4117.09 and to enact sections 3317.141 and 5126.241 of the Revised Code to revise the eligibility for the state stipends to National Board certified teachers; to permit school districts, educational service centers, and county MR/DD boards to pay wage rate differentials above their regular salary schedules for certain teachers; and to specify that teacher wage rate differentials, the length of the school year, and the length of the school day are not subjects for collective bargaining.

422.title: School performance ratings-eliminate index score; school enrollment options
422.description: To amend sections 3302.01, 3302.021, 3302.03, 3302.031, 3302.04, 3312.04, 3313.6013, 3365.02, 3365.03, 3365.05, 3365.07, and 3365.08 and to enact sections 3313.6015, 3365.022, and 3365.15 of the Revised Code to eliminate the performance index score as a factor in school district and building performance ratings, to make changes in the Post-Secondary Enrollment Options Program, and to make changes in the requirement that schools offer dual enrollment programs.

423.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
423.title: Cell phones-text messaging while driving-prohibit
423.description: To amend section 4510.01 and to enact section 4511.204 of the Revised Code to prohibit driving a vehicle while text messaging or typing on a mobile communication device and to establish the violation as a secondary traffic offense.

424.title: School bus drivers-maintain control of pupils; liability for failure to do so
424.description: To amend section 2744.02 and to enact section 3327.101 of the Revised Code to require a person employed as a driver of a school bus or motor van to maintain control of the pupils on that school bus or motor van and to provide an exception to political subdivision sovereign immunity if injury, death, or loss to person or property results from the failure of the driver of a school bus or motor van to maintain control of the pupils on that school bus or motor van.

425.title: Marriage & family therapy practice/board professional standards committees
425.description: To amend sections 4757.01, 4757.04, 4757.21, 4757.26, 4757.30, and 4757.36 of the Revised Code regarding the practice of marriage and family therapy and the membership of the professional standards committees of the Counselor, Social Worker, and Marriage and Family Therapist Board.

426.title: School employee misconduct-reporting of and disciplining for

427.title: Sales tax-convert to origin-based sourcing/discontinue tax loss compensation
427.description: To amend sections 5703.70, 5739.03, 5739.033, 5739.034, 5739.24, 5741.03, and 5741.05 and to enact section 5739.061 of the Revised Code and later to repeal sections 5739.035, 5739.123, 5739.24, and 5740.10 of the Revised Code to require vendors to utilize origin-based sourcing for intrastate sales beginning January 1, 2010, to discontinue compensation of impacted counties for sales tax losses incurred under destination-based sourcing, to compensate vendors required to convert from destination-based sourcing to origin-based sourcing, to permit a vendor, when making a refund, to retain the amount of the delivery charge and sales taxes attributable to the charge, and to declare an emergency.

428.title: Sex offenders-prohibit from being on school premises
428.description: To amend section 2950.99 and to enact section 2950.035 of the Revised Code to prohibit adult tier III sex offender/child-victim offenders who have committed specified offenses against a victim under sixteen years of age from knowingly being present on school premises or preschool or child day-care premises.

429.title: Emergency workers-presume incur disease while on duty-workers' comp/retirement
429.description: To amend sections 742.38, 4123.57, and 4123.68 of the Revised Code to provide that a firefighter or emergency medical services worker who is disabled as a result of cancer or certain contagious or infectious diseases is presumed for purposes of the laws governing workers' compensation and the Ohio Police and Fire Pension Fund to have incurred the disease while performing official duties as a firefighter or emergency medical services worker.

430.title: New African Immigrants Commission-advocate for sub-Saharans in Ohio
430.description: To enact sections 4112.31, 4112.32, and 4112.33 of the Revised Code to establish a New African Immigrants Commission to advocate for the development and implementation of policies and programs to address the needs of the State's sub-Saharan African population.

431.title: Income tax exemption-state/federal government retirement benefits
431.description: To amend section 5747.01 of the Revised Code to exempt from the personal income tax up to $10,000 in state and federal government retirement benefits for taxable years beginning in 2010 and thereafter.

432.last_action: To Local and Municipal Government & Urban Revitalization
432.title: Convey state-owned realty in Wood County
432.description: To authorize the conveyance of state-owned real estate located in Wood County.

433.last_action: To State & Local Government & Veterans Affairs
433.title: Office of Faith-Based and Community Initiatives-reform
433.description: To amend section 107.12 of the Revised Code to reform the Governor's Office of Faith-Based and Community Initiatives.

434.last_action: To Local and Municipal Government & Urban Revitalization
434.title: Local water tank repair & maintenance-contract for without bidding
434.description: To amend sections 307.86, 6101.16, 6103.10, 6115.20, and 6119.10 and to enact section 735.054 of the Revised Code to authorize municipal and other political subdivision contracts for maintenance and repair of a water storage tank to be awarded without competitive bidding under specified conditions.

435.title: Home improvement contractors-regulate performance/remedies
435.description: To enact sections 4722.01 to 4722.07 of the Revised Code to establish the Ohio Home Improvement Contractor Law, to deem that specified violations of the law constitute a violation of the Ohio Consumer Sales Practices Act, and to provide civil remedies for owners who are damaged by a contractor who violates the law.

436.title: Agricultural society police officers-appointment/commissioning/training
436.description: To amend sections 109.71, 109.73, and 109.79 and to enact sections 1711.351 and 1711.352  of the Revised Code relative to the appointment and commissioning of county agricultural society police officers and to the training of those officers.

437.title: Suicide prevention services-provide for grades five to twelve
437.description: To amend section 3314.03 and to enact section 3313.719 of the Revised Code to require each school district and each community school to provide suicide prevention services for students in grades five to twelve.

438.title: Rental agreement-does not terminate upon foreclosure of landlord's mortgage
438.description: To enact section 5321.20 of the Revised Code to provide that a rental agreement does not terminate upon the foreclosure of the landlord's mortgage.

439.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
439.title: Probationary driver-moving violation-one-time privilege-drive unaccompanied
439.description: To amend section 4507.071 of the Revised Code to allow a court, under certain circumstances, to grant unaccompanied driving privileges one time to a probationary driver's license holder who, because of a moving violation, otherwise would be subject to a restriction that the person be accompanied by the holder's parent or guardian.

440.title: Court-ordered parenting time-employers honor without recrimination
440.description: To enact section 3109.054 of the Revised Code to require certain employers to allow a parent to exercise court-ordered parenting time without terminating employment, reducing pay, or taking other similar action against the parent.

441.title: State-Sanctioned Public Notice Website/public notice by newspaper-changes
441.description: To amend sections 7.12 and 5721.01 and to enact sections 7.16, 125.181, 125.182, 125.183, and 5721.012 of  the Revised Code to establish the State-Sanctioned Public Notice web site, to permit any notice required to be published by statute or rule to be published on the web site, and to make changes to the qualifications for newspapers publishing public notices and the methods by which newspapers publish notice.

442.title: Construction industry licensing laws-control unlicensed contractors
442.description: To amend sections 4740.01, 4740.02, 4740.04, and 4740.07 and to enact section 4740.16 of the Revised Code to make changes to the construction industry licensing laws to discipline unlicensed contractors and eliminate unlicensed contractor activity.

443.title: Classroom facilities assistance-adjust rankings-tax exempt property
443.description: To require adjustments in a school district's state education aid and Classroom Facilities Assistance Program rankings to correct certifications of tax-exempt property erroneously treated as taxable property.

444.last_action: To State & Local Government & Veterans Affairs
444.title: Animal control-revise statutes

445.title: Community-based correctional facility-if none available-county plan for one
445.description: To enact section 2301.511 of the Revised Code to require a county that does not have a community-based correctional facility or a district community-based correctional facility available for the use of that county's courts to formulate a proposal for such a facility.

446.title: Missing persons
446.description: To amend sections 313.08, 2901.41, and 2901.42 and to enact sections 109.5731 and 2901.43 of the Revised Code relative to missing persons in Ohio.

447.title: Cosmetologists/associated practitioners-practice out of mobile salons
447.description: To amend section 4713.01 and to enact section 4713.18 of the Revised Code to specifically allow estheticians, hair designers, manicurists, natural hair stylists, and cosmetologists to operate out of a salon that is a mobile unit if that unit is at least one thousand feet from the nearest salon that is housed in a permanent structure.

448.title: Armed services member 18-21-purchase handgun-if has had firearms training
448.description: To amend sections 2923.125 and  2923.211 of the Revised Code to permit a member of the armed services or the Ohio National Guard who is between the ages of 18 and 21 to purchase a handgun if the person has received firearms training and to clarify the residency criterion for the issuance of a concealed carry license for persons who are absent from, or who are present in, the state in compliance with military or naval orders.

449.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
449.title: "Multiple Sclerosis Awareness" license plates
449.description: To amend section 4501.21 and to enact section 4503.494 of the Revised Code to create "Multiple Sclerosis Awareness" license plates.

450.title: Classroom Facilities Assistance Program-alternate equity list
450.description: To calculate an alternate equity list for fiscal year 2008 for purposes of determining school districts' eligibility for assistance under the Classroom Facilities Assistance Program and their local shares in fiscal year 2009.

451.title: Liability for medical care for person in municipal custody
451.description: To enact sections 505.59 and 753.022 of the Revised Code regarding liability for medical care provided to persons imprisoned in a municipal corporation's institution or in the custody of a municipal corporation's law enforcement officer.

452.title: Community schools-nonprofit operators/moratorium on brick & mortar
452.description: To amend sections 3313.41, 3314.013, 3314.014, 3314.02, 3314.021, 3314.051, and 3318.08, to enact section 3314.027, and to repeal sections 3314.016 and 3314.017 of the Revised Code to establish a moratorium on new "brick and mortar" community schools until July 1, 2010, to require community school operators to be nonprofit entities, and to eliminate the requirement that school districts offer property suitable for classroom space for sale to community schools under certain conditions.

453.title: Historic building rehabilitation tax credit certificate-permit county to assign
453.description: To amend sections 149.311, 5725.151, 5733.47, and 5747.76 and to enact section 5703.75 of the Revised Code to authorize a county that is issued a historic building rehabilitation tax credit certificate to assign the certificate to another person.

454.title: Ohio CARE-establish/Hospital Care Assurance Program fund limits & denials

455.title: Election forms: receipt of incorrect form/form identification/candidate withdrawal
455.description: To amend sections 3501.38, 3513.041, 3513.261, and 3513.30 of the Revised Code to require a board of elections that distributes an incorrect petition to a person seeking to become a candidate to accept that petition as though it were the proper petition and to verify the signatures that appear on the petition; to require forms for nominating petitions for independent candidates and statements of candidacy for write-in candidates to be clearly identified at the top of the forms; and to require the secretary of state to prescribe, and boards of elections and the secretary of state to distribute, a standard withdrawal form for a candidate who wishes to withdraw as a candidate.

456.title: Subdivision general levy-use for roads and bridges/township health insurance
456.description: To amend sections 505.60, 505.601, 5705.05, and 5705.06 of the Revised Code to authorize the taxing authority of a subdivision to use money derived from the general levy for current expenses for road and bridge construction and repair, and to make clarifying changes to the laws authorizing a township to provide health care insurance.

457.title: Civil action: change death certificate or coroner's verdict
457.description: To amend section 313.19 of the Revised Code to establish procedures for the commencement, determination, and appeal of an action to change a death certificate or coroner's verdict.

458.title: Charitable auctions-apprentice auctioneer conduct unsupervised
458.description: To amend section 4707.09 of the Revised Code to allow an apprentice auctioneer to conduct an auction for a charitable organization without supervision by a licensed auctioneer.

459.title: Employer reimburse Workers' Comp-first $15,000 of medical bills-in any claim
459.description: To amend section 4123.29 of the Revised Code to allow an employer to reimburse the Administrator of Workers' Compensation for the first fifteen thousand dollars of medical bills incurred in any type of workers' compensation claim rather than allow an employer to pay directly only those medical bills incurred in medical-only claims.

460.title: State amphibian-bullfrog
460.description: To enact section 5.033 of the Revised Code to adopt the bullfrog as the state amphibian.

461.title: Triple Negative Breast Cancer Commission
461.description: To enact section 3701.265 of the Revised Code to create the Triple Negative Breast Cancer Commission.

462.title: Lottery profits-annual per-pupil distribution to public/nonpublic schools
462.description: To amend section 3770.06 and to enact section 3317.0212 of the Revised Code to require that a portion of lottery profits be distributed annually on a per pupil basis to public and chartered nonpublic schools.

463.last_action: To Local and Municipal Government & Urban Revitalization
463.title: Townships-regulate public dances
463.description: To enact sections 503.70 to   503.78 and 503.99 of the Revised Code to permit townships to issue permits for public dances.

464.title: Municipal police commanders- qualifications- reciprocity with other states
464.description: To amend sections 109.75 and 109.77 and to enact section 109.762 of the Revised Code to exempt an individual who is appointed to a command position with a police department of an Ohio municipal corporation from Ohio's peace officer certification and training requirements if the individual has served in a command position with a police department of a municipal corporation in another state and has completed a basic training program comparable to Ohio's peace officer basic training program and the other state provides a similar exemption.

465.title: Delinquent child misdemeanants-collect DNA samples from
465.description: To amend sections 2152.74 and 2901.07 of the Revised Code to require the collection of a DNA specimen from all persons who are convicted of, plead guilty to, or are adjudicated a delinquent child for a misdemeanor other than a misdemeanor for which a citation is issued.

466.title: Public employee collective bargaining- educational employees- remove exemption
466.description: A BILLTo amend sections 4117.01 and 4117.03 of the Revised Code to eliminate an exemption from the Public Employees' Collective Bargaining Law for specified educational employees.

467.title: Grocery stores for underserved areas-loans/loan guarantees to establish
467.description: To amend section 166.01 of the Revised Code to allow Chapter 166. loans and loan guarantees to be made to establish supermarkets and grocery stores in underserved communities.

468.title: Township trustees-remove vegetation that blocks sight lines
468.description: To amend section 5543.14 and to enact sections 503.35, 5543.15, and 5571.18 of the Revised Code to authorize a board of county commissioners and a board of township trustees to order removal of vegetation on private property that blocks or otherwise interferes with the sight lines of motorists traveling on county or township roads, to authorize a board of township trustees to require certain ditches or culverts located in the township to be cleaned, and to require notice be given to abutting landowners before the trimming or removal of certain vegetation growing in or encroaching onto the right-of-way of county or township roads.

469.title: Coroners-duties & powers/pay/criminal investigation records-confidential
469.description: To amend sections 313.05, 313.10, 313.16, and 325.15 and to enact section 313.211 of the Revised Code to change certain powers and duties of coroners, to specify that certain records of a decedent relating to the criminal investigation of the decedent's death are not public records, and to provide supplemental compensation to full-time coroners in counties with a population exceeding 175,000 who supervise and coordinate the additional workload involved in performing autopsies under contract for at least ten other counties.

470.title: Ditch maintenance-adjust assessment basis/soil and water conservation improvements
470.description: To amend section 1515.29 and to enact section 6137.112 of the Revised Code to allow a board of county commissioners to adjust the permanent base of a ditch improvement that is used for maintenance fund assessments and to allow a board to use certain ditch maintenance procedures to maintain soil and water conservation district improvements.

471.title: Mobility-impaired persons-use electric all-purpose vehicles to hunt-DNR permit
471.description: To amend sections 1531.01, 1533.01, and 2923.16 and to enact section 1533.103 of the Revised Code to require the Chief of the Division of Wildlife in the Department of Natural Resources to issue electric-powered all-purpose vehicle permits to allow mobility impaired persons to hunt in public wildlife areas using electric-powered all-purpose vehicles.

472.title: Instant bingo ticket dispensers-revise definition/charitable organizations use
472.description: To amend sections 2915.01 and 2915.091 of the Revised Code to change the definition of "instant bingo ticket dispenser" and to authorize a charitable organization to purchase, lease, and use instant bingo ticket dispensers.

473.title: Childhood Cancer Awareness Month-September
473.description: To enact section 5.2238 of the Revised Code to designate the month of September as Childhood Cancer Awareness Month.

474.title: Single/multi-family dwellings-fossil fuel heating-have carbon monoxide alarm
474.description: To enact section 3781.106 of the Revised Code to require owners of single-family and multifamily dwellings that utilize fossil fuels for heating or other purposes to have carbon monoxide alarms installed in those dwellings.

475.last_action: To State & Local Government & Veterans Affairs
475.title: English-required language for official proceedings
475.description: To enact sections 5.15, 5.151, and 5.152 of the Revised Code to require the use of the English language by state and local government entities in official actions and proceedings, subject to certain exceptions.

476.title: Concealed-carry license fee-refundable income tax credit for
476.description: To amend sections 5747.08 and 5747.98 and to enact section 5747.72 of the Revised Code to allow a refundable tax credit against the personal income tax for concealed-carry license fees.

477.last_action: To Financial Institutions, Real Estate, & Securities
477.title: Ohio Police and Fire Pension Fund trustees-election of chairperson
477.description: To amend section 742.03 of the Revised Code regarding election of the chairperson of the Ohio Police and Fire Pension Board of Trustees.

478.title: Regional transit authority levying property tax-joining/withdrawing from
478.description: To enact sections 306.322 and 306.55 of the Revised Code to create an additional procedure for subdivisions to join a regional transit authority that levies a property tax and that includes a county having a population of at least 400,000 and to allow a subdivision that is a member of such a regional transit authority to withdraw from the authority.

479.title: Uninsured/underinsured motorist coverage
479.description: To amend sections 2305.16 and 3937.18 of the Revised Code to include in the definition of uninsured motorist, operators who avoid liability because of a "sudden emergency" plea, to prohibit uninsured and underinsured coverage from limiting or contracting certain coverage requirements, and to include uninsured motorist and underinsured motorist coverage in the current tolling of the statute of limitations due to the person bringing an action being within the age of minority or of unsound mind.

480.title: Public records-bulk data requests/charge for redacting information
480.description: To amend section 149.43 of the Revised Code to authorize public offices to limit the number of bulk data requests, impose charges to cover the actual costs associated with bulk data requests, and charge for the cost of redacting certain information.

481.title: Elevator contractors/ mechanics- license/elevator service & inspection
481.description: A BILLTo amend sections 4105.01, 4105.011, 4105.02, 4105.03, 4105.04, 4105.07 to 4105.17, 4105.191, 4105.20, 4105.21, 4740.01 to 4740.07, 4740.12, and 4740.13 and to enact sections 4740.062 and 4740.071 of the Revised Code to create the Elevator Section of the Ohio Construction Industry Licensing Board, to require licensure of elevator contractors and elevator mechanics, and to make changes to the laws governing elevator servicing and inspections.

482.title: Classroom facilities assistance-alternate equity list for FY 2009 funding
482.description: To calculate an alternative equity list for fiscal year 2009 funding under the Classroom Facilities Assistance Program and the Exceptional Needs School Facilities Assistance Program for certain school districts with large one-year reductions in valuation.

483.title: Safe Havens Act-longer time to act under/study in high school health curriculum
483.description: To amend sections 2151.3516 and 3313.60 of the Revised Code to increase the number of hours after birth that a parent may voluntarily deliver the child to a safe haven without the parent expressing an intent to return for the child and to include awareness of the Safe Havens Law in the health curriculum prescribed for high school students.

484.title: Watercraft law-changes to
484.description: To amend sections 1547.14, 1547.24, 1547.99, and 1548.032 and to enact sections 1547.072 and 1547.132 of the Revised Code to make changes to the laws governing watercraft.

485.title: Energy: renewable and advanced energy/energy efficiency/benchmarks
485.description: To amend section 1571.01 and to enact sections 1572.01, 1572.02, 1572.03, 1572.04, 1572.05, 1572.06, 1572.07, 3706.31, 3706.32, 3706.33, 3706.34, 3706.35, 3706.36, 4928.64, 4928.65, 4928.66, 4928.68, and 5501.452 of the Revised Code to establish alternative energy benchmarks for electric distribution utilities and electric services companies, provide for the use of renewable energy credits, establish energy efficiency standards for electric distribution utilities and require the Department of Development to establish energy efficiency programs, create the Ohio Renewable Energy Authority to provide loans and grants to renewable energy businesses, establish policies regarding the geologic storage of carbon dioxide, and require greenhouse gas emission reporting and carbon control planning for generating facilities.

486.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
486.title: "In God We Trust" license plates
486.description: To enact section 4503.762 of the Revised Code to create "In God We Trust" license plates.

487.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
487.title: Peter J. Delucia Memorial Bridge-Interstate 76 in Mahoning County
487.description: A BILLTo enact section 5533.091 of the Revised Code to designate the Lake Milton Bridge, which is located in Mahoning County and is part of Interstate Route 76, as the "Peter J. Delucia Memorial Bridge."

488.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
488.title: Infrastructure Protection Center-create
488.description: To amend section 5502.03 and to enact section 5502.04 of the Revised Code to create the Infrastructure Protection Center within the Division of Homeland Security of the Department of Public Safety.

489.title: Fire extinguishers/carbon monoxide detectors-require in residences
489.description: To amend sections 3781.10, 3781.104, and 5302.30 of the Revised Code to require fire extinguishers and carbon monoxide detectors in residential buildings and residential units, to direct the Board of Building Standards to adopt rules that establish product and installation standards for fire extinguishers and carbon monoxide detectors, to require transferors of residential real property to disclose whether fire extinguishers and carbon monoxide detectors are installed in their property, and to prohibit a transferor of residential real property from entering into a transfer agreement unless fire extinguishers and carbon monoxide detectors are installed as the bill requires.

490.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
490.title: Cpl. Samuel F. Pearson Memorial Highway-part of State Route 66 in Miami County
490.description: To enact section 5533.821 of the Revised Code to designate a portion of State Route 66 within Miami County as the "Cpl. Samuel F. Pearson Memorial Highway."

491.title: Anatomic pathology services-billing for
491.description: To amend section 4731.22 and to enact sections 3701.86, 3701.861, 3701.862, 4731.72, 4731.721, 4731.722, and 4731.723 of the Revised Code regarding billing for anatomic pathology services.

492.title: Sanitary districts for reducing biting arthropods-revise law for
492.description: To amend sections 6115.04, 6115.05, 6115.06, 6115.08, 6115.16, 6115.46, and 6115.69 and to enact sections 6115.051, 6115.081, 6115.082, 6115.091, 6115.092, 6115.093, 6115.094, 6115.095, 6115.096, and 6115.321 of the Revised Code to revise the law governing sanitary districts that are organized wholly for the reduction of populations of biting arthropods.

493.title: State college student health insurance plans-not required of students
493.description: To enact section 3345.023 of the Revised Code to prohibit state institutions of higher education from requiring a student to purchase the institution's health insurance plan.

494.title: Capital reappropriations for biennium ending June 30, 2010
494.description: Capital reappropriations for biennium ending June 30, 2010

495.title: Lithopolis Honeyfest Day-first Saturday after first Monday in September
495.description: To enact section 5.2239 of the Revised Code to designate the first Saturday following the first Monday in September as "Lithopolis Honeyfest Day."

496.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
496.title: Military leave-firefighters/other public employees-nontraditional work schedules
496.description: To amend section 5923.05 of the Revised Code to grant annual military leave of up to 408 hours to firefighters and those other public employees who do not work a traditional workweek of 40 hours and to entitle firefighters and these public employees to use such leave to cover an entire work shift any part of which was used to perform military service.

498.title: Cigarettes-standards for reduced ignition propensity
498.description: To amend section 5703.21 and to enact sections 3739.01 to 3739.18 and 3739.99 of the Revised Code to establish reduced ignition propensity standards for cigarettes, to authorize the State Fire Marshal to monitor and the Attorney General and the State Fire Marshal to enforce such standards, and to establish penalties for violations.

499.title: Ohio Beekeepers Task Force-create
499.description: To create the Ohio Beekeepers Task Force.

500.title: Sexual orientation-prohibit discrimination on basis of

501.title: Psychologists-experience and training qualifications
501.description: To amend sections 4732.10 and 5122.01 of the Revised Code regarding the experience and training requirements necessary for admission to examination for a psychologist license.

502.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
502.title: Juvenile driver improvement program-require for limited driving under suspended license
502.description: To amend sections 4510.31 and 4510.311 of the Revised Code to require probationary driver's license holders to complete a juvenile driver improvement program prior to exercising limited driving privileges granted during a license suspension.

503.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
503.title: Other-country registered commercial motor vehicles-pilot inspection project
503.description: To require the Motor Carrier Enforcement Unit of the Department of Public Safety to conduct a pilot project involving the inspection of commercial motor vehicles that are registered in another country and are operated in this state.

504.title: Political telephone calls-regulate
504.description: To amend section 4719.99 and to enact sections 4719.25, 4719.251, 4719.252, 4719.253, 4719.254, 4719.255, 4719.256, and 4719.257 of the Revised Code to prohibit making a political call without providing certain source identification, to prohibit initiating a political call that uses artificial or prerecorded voice messages to any telephone number that appears on a no-automated political call list to be developed, operated, and maintained by the Attorney General, and to provide for the act's enforcement by the Attorney General.

505.title: Teacher license-pay fee in installments/tax credit for fee and criminal records check
505.description: To amend sections 3319.51, 5747.08 and 5747.98 and to enact section 5747.71 of the Revised Code to allow teachers to pay license renewal fees in annual installments, and to allow a refundable credit against the income tax for educator licensing fees and educator-paid criminal records check fees.

506.title: Ticket brokers-registration/prohibit purchasing tickets from original seller
506.description: To amend section 1333.99 and to enact section 1333.58 of the Revised Code to require that ticket brokers register with the Department of Commerce and to prohibit a ticket broker from purchasing tickets from the original ticket seller.

507.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
507.title: LCPL Danny Scherry Memorial Highway-Interstate 90
507.description: To enact section 5533.351 of the Revised Code to designate the portion of Interstate Highway 90 located within the municipal corporation of Rocky River in Cuyahoga County as the "LCPL Danny Scherry Memorial Highway."

508.title: Higher ed police/medical services/threat assessors-access to student records
508.description: To enact section 3345.43 of the Revised Code to require state institutions of higher education to designate their law enforcement and medical services units and their threat assessment teams as "school officials" for purposes of receiving student education records under federal law.

509.last_action: To Local and Municipal Government & Urban Revitalization
509.title: Park bylaws and rules-penalties for violation
509.description: To amend sections 1545.09 and 1545.99 of the Revised Code to provide increased penalties for violations of a bylaw or rule adopted by a board of park commissioners of a park district in a county and to permit a board of park commissioners to adopt penalties for any such violation provided the penalties do not exceed in severity the penalty designated by state law for a similar violation under state law.

510.title: Enhanced penalty-driving under suspension-applies also if driving without license
510.description: To amend section 2903.06 of the Revised Code to provide that the penalty enhancement for aggravated vehicular homicide, vehicular homicide, and vehicular manslaughter for driving under a license suspension and the requirement for a mandatory prison term in certain cases of aggravated vehicular homicide and vehicular homicide for driving under suspension also apply to driving under cancellation and driving without a license.

511.title: Community development corporation-eligible for bingo license
511.description: To amend section 2915.01 of the Revised Code to designate a community development corporation organization as a charitable organization eligible to be issued a bingo license.

512.title: Lottery-prohibit certain games-such as keno & those played on slot machines
512.description: To amend section 3770.03 of the Revised Code to prohibit the State Lottery Commission from establishing a lottery game that has more than two announcements of prize winners per day or that is played on a slot machine, including a game of keno.

513.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
513.title: Veterans-state ID/driver's license-no fee
513.description: To amend sections 4507.23, 4507.24, and 4507.50 of the Revised Code to permit retired and honorably discharged veterans of the armed forces of the United States and the Ohio National Guard to apply for state-issued identification cards and new and renewal driver's licenses without the payment of any fee.

514.title: Income tax deduction-bank account interest
514.description: To amend section 5747.01 of the Revised Code to authorize an income tax deduction for interest from deposits in certain bank accounts.

515.title: Study actual per pupil cost of public education
515.description: To enact section 3317.018 of the Revised Code to establish a committee to study the actual per pupil cost of educating students in public schools and make recommendations regarding the funding of public schools.

516.title: Grants-training for employees in biotechnology and bioscience
516.description: To enact section 122.042 of the Revised Code to require the Director of Development to administer a grant program to provide funding to specified entities to provide training for employees in the fields of biotechnology and bioscience or any other field in which critical demands exist for certain skills.

517.title: Require parents of students to volunteer in schools
517.description: To amend sections 109.57, 5733.01, 5733.98, and 5751.98 and to enact sections 124.1311, 3313.88, 3321.30, 5733.54, 5747.124, and 5751.54 of the Revised Code to require parents of students enrolled in school districts to perform volunteer service for the district, to grant state employees paid leave to participate in a child's educational activities, to allow a nonrefundable credit against the corporate franchise or commercial activity tax for employer-paid leave enabling employees to participate in school-related activities, and to require school districts to establish mentoring programs for students.

518.title: Flooding-schools closed-make-up days-waive requirement
518.description: To waive the requirement for certain school districts to make up days schools are closed due to flooding and to declare an emergency.

519.last_action: To Local and Municipal Government & Urban Revitalization
519.title: Develop recommendations-reform & restructure Ohio local government
519.description: To create the Ohio Commission on Local Government Reform and Collaboration to develop recommendations on reforming and restructuring local government in Ohio.

520.title: Uniform Prudent Management of Institutional Funds Act
520.description: To amend sections 1715.51, 1715.52, 1715.55, 1715.56, 1715.57, 1715.58, 1715.59, 3345.05, and 5813.06; to amend, for the purpose of adopting new section numbers as indicated in parentheses, sections 1715.52 (1715.53), 1715.55 (1715.54), 1715.56 (1715.52), and 1715.57 (1715.55); to enact new sections 1715.56 and 1715.57; and to repeal sections 1715.53 and 1715.54 of the Revised Code for the purpose of adopting the Uniform Prudent Management of Institutional Funds Act by revising the Ohio Uniform Management of Institutional Funds Act.

521.title: Suspicous deaths-coroner administer chemical tests if paid for/public record
521.description: To amend section 313.131 and to enact section 313.124 of the Revised Code to require a coroner, deputy coroner, or pathologist to administer chemical tests to the blood of a deceased person who died by suicide or in any suspicious or unusual manner when the tests are requested and paid for by a family member of the deceased and to clarify that the results of the tests are public records.

522.title: Agreement Among the States to Elect the President by National Popular Vote-adopt
522.description: To amend sections 3505.39 and 3505.40 and to enact section 3505.381 of the Revised Code to adopt the Agreement Among the States to Elect the President by National Popular Vote.

523.title: Recordable documents-be in standard format
523.description: To amend section 317.36 and to  enact sections 317.083, 317.114, and 5301.461 of the Revised Code to establish standard format requirements for documents to be recorded by a county recorder and to allow recording of a single instrument for multiple transactions pertaining to oil and gas.

524.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
524.title: "Thank you U.S. Military" license plate
524.description: To amend section 4501.21 and to enact section 4503.531 of the Revised Code to create the "Thank you U.S. Military" license plate.

525.title: Lorain County Domestic Relations judges-prevent changes
525.description: To amend sections 2101.01, 2301.02, and 2301.03 of the Revised Code to prevent the changes provided for in Am. Sub. S.B. 128 of the 126th General Assembly with regard to the probate judge and the judges of the Domestic Relations Division of the Lorain County Court of Common Pleas from going into effect.

526.title: Water key-prohibit sale of to anyone other than a plumber
526.description: To enact section 3703.25 of the Revised Code to prohibit a person from selling a water key to any individual other than a plumber.

528.title: Linked deposit program-encourage savings and promote personal financial education
528.description: To amend section 135.63 and to enact sections 135.101, 135.102, 135.103, 135.104, 135.105, and 135.106 of the Revised Code to authorize the Treasurer of State to administer a linked deposit program designed to encourage personal savings and promote personal financial education.

529.title: Public nuisance-expand concept/sales free of liens and encumbrances
529.description: To amend section 3767.41 of the Revised Code to expand the law governing the abatement of public nuisances to buildings not occupied by an owner as a primary residence with three or fewer residential units and to vacant land and to make the title in property sold by court order pursuant to a public nuisance action free and clear of most liens and encumbrances.

530.title: Xeroderma Pigmentosum Research Commission
530.description: To enact section 3701.136 of the Revised Code to create the Xeroderma Pigmentosum Research Commission.

531.title: Unwanted fax advertisement to business-no criminal penalty/civil recovery instead
531.description: To amend sections 4931.75 and 4931.99 of the Revised Code to abolish the criminal penalty for sending an unwanted facsimile advertisement to a business entity, and to establish that a person may recover one thousand dollars in a civil action for such a violation.

532.title: Personal income tax-phase out over ten years
532.description: To amend sections 5747.02 and 5747.41 of the Revised Code to phase out the personal income tax over ten years.

533.title: E-Book Higher Education Task Force/e-book programs at all state colleges
533.description: To enact section 3333.29 of the Revised Code to create the E-Book Higher Education Task Force and to require the Chancellor of the Ohio Board of Regents to implement e-book programs at all state institutions of higher education.

534.title: Healthy Families Act
534.description: To enact sections 4114.00 to 4114.11 of the Revised Code to enact the Healthy Families Act.

535.title: Civil action-permit retired judge to preside over jury trial
535.description: To amend section 2701.10 of the Revised Code to permit a civil action referred to a retired judge for consideration and adjudication to be tried and determined by a jury presided over by the retired judge.

536.title: Tier III sex offenders/child-victim offenders-lifetime GPS monitoring
536.description: To amend sections 2743.191, 2929.13, 2929.15, 2929.23, 2929.25, 2967.28, 2971.03, and 2971.05 and to enact section 2967.29 of the Revised Code to require the imposition at sentencing or upon release from prison of lifetime active global positioning system device monitoring for Tier III sex offenders/child-victim offenders.

537.title: Schools closed because of flood damage-waive minimum number of school days
537.description: To waive the minimum number of school days in the 2007-2008 school year for certain public schools permanently closed due to flood damage and to declare an emergency.

538.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
538.title: Public Transit Funding Task Force
538.description: To create the Public Transit Funding Task Force to study Ohio's public transportation funding and issue a report.

539.title: Noncitizen-register motor vehicle-provide evidence of legal presence in U.S.
539.description: To amend sections 4503.10 and 4503.102 of the Revised Code to require a person who is not a citizen of the United States to submit documentary evidence proving that the person is present in this country in accordance with federal law when obtaining or renewing a motor vehicle certificate of registration.

540.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
540.title: Adult remedial driving courses-eliminate percentage to be taken in person
540.description: To amend sections 4510.037 and 4510.038 of the Revised Code to eliminate the requirement that at least 50% of adult remedial driving courses be taken in person.

541.title: Accident prevention courses-insurance premiums reduced-modify when
541.description: To amend section 3937.43 of the Revised Code to modify the conditions under which an insurer must reduce automobile insurance premiums for persons over a specified age who complete a motor vehicle accident prevention course.

542.title: Tobacco Use Prevention and Control Foundation-abolish
542.description: To amend sections 102.02, 183.021, 183.30, 183.33, and 2151.87; to enact sections 3701.84 and 3701.841; to repeal sections 183.03, 183.04, 183.05, 183.06, 183.061, 183.07, 183.08, 183.09, and 183.10 of the Revised Code; to repeal Section 3 of Am. S.B. 192 of the 127th General Assembly, to repeal Section 4 of S.B. 209 of the 127th General Assembly, and to repeal Section 205.10 of Sub. S.B. 321 of the 126th General Assembly to abolish the Tobacco Use Prevention and Control Foundation and transfer certain powers of the Foundation to the Department of Health, to make an appropriation, and to declare an emergency.

543.title: Short-term lending-regulation
543.description: To amend sections 109.572, 135.63, 1181.05, 1181.21, 1181.25, 1315.99, 1321.02, 1321.15, 1321.21, 1321.99, 1345.01, 1349.71, 1349.72, 1733.25, and 2307.61, to enact sections 121.085, 135.68, 135.69, 135.70, 1321.35,  1321.36, 1321.37, 1321.38, 1321.39, 1321.40, 1321.41, 1321.42, 1321.421, 1321.422, 1321.43, 1321.44, 1321.45, 1321.46, 1321.461, 1321.47, and 1321.48, and to repeal sections 1315.35, 1315.36, 1315.37, 1315.38, 1315.39, 1315.40, 1315.41, 1315.42, 1315.43, and 1315.44 of the Revised Code to repeal the Check-Cashing Lender Law, to establish the Short-Term Lender Law, to create a short-term installment loan linked deposit program, to further restrict the making of multiple loans under the Small Loan Law,  to expand the responsibilities of the Consumer Finance Education Board, and to make other related changes.

544.title: Real property taxes-rebate for timely payment
544.description: To enact sections 323.80 and 5739.214 of the Revised Code to provide an ongoing rebate to owners of residential or agricultural property who timely pay property taxes.

545.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
545.title: Parking locations for disabled-remove snow and ice within 24 hours
545.description: To amend sections 3781.111, 3781.99, and 4511.69 of the Revised Code to require the removal of snow or ice from special parking locations designated for persons with disabilities within 24 hours after the weather condition causing the snow or ice ceases.

546.title: State children's book/author: Lentil/Robert McCloskey
546.description: To enact section 5.091 of the Revised Code to adopt the children's book Lentil as the official children's book of the state and to designate its author, Robert McCloskey, as the official children's book author of the state.

547.title: School boards-installment contracts for on-site energy generation/conservation
547.description: To amend section 3313.372 of the Revised Code to authorize school boards, for on-site energy generation measures and in the same manner as for energy conservation measures, to enter into installment contracts subject to specified terms of payment and to provide that energy conservation installment contracts are subject to those same terms.

548.title: Extend wireless 911 charge/raise fund disbursals/broaden use of disbursals
548.description: To amend sections 4931.61, 4931.62, 4931.63, 4931.64, 4931.65, 4931.66, and 4931.70 of the Revised Code to extend until 2013 the wireless 9-1-1 charge, to raise the minimum, annual fund disbursement amount for each county from $25,000 to $90,000, and to broaden local uses of that revenue.

549.title: Coal mining-mine operation permits/oil and gas well siting
549.description: To amend sections 1509.01, 1509.08, and 1513.07 of the Revised Code to revise the requirements in the Oil and Gas Law concerning the location of a well in a coal bearing township, to revise the application requirements for a coal mining operation permit, and to define "affected mine" for purposes of the Oil and Gas Law.

550.title: Start-up community school-no contract with operator rated academic watch/emergency
550.description: To amend section 3314.016 of the Revised Code to revise the exception to the cap on new start-up community schools by prohibiting contracts with operators that manage other Ohio community schools that have report card ratings of academic watch or academic emergency.

552.title: Economic stimuli
552.description: To amend sections 149.311, 166.01, 166.02, 166.08, 166.11, 184.02, 1555.03, 3333.38, 3345.32, 3706.01, 5725.151, 5733.47, 5747.76, and 5747.98; to enact sections 164.28, 166.25, 166.26, 166.27, 166.30, 184.174, 184.23, 184.231, 184.24 to 184.26, 184.37, 3333.71 to 3333.81, and 3706.25 to 3706.30 of the Revised Code; and to amend Section 229.10 of Am. Sub. H.B. 67 of the 127th General Assembly, to establish the Ohio Bioproducts Development Program and Ohio Biomedical Development Program to be administered by the Third Frontier Commission, to establish advisory boards to the Third Frontier Commission, to expand the economic development programs administered by the Department of Development to include transportation logistics and distribution infrastructure projects, to provide additional money for capital improvement projects of local subdivisions, to modify the authority of the Ohio Coal Development Office, to provide for advanced energy projects administered by the Ohio Air Quality Development Authority, to establish the Choose Ohio First Co-op/Internship Program, to extend the historical building rehabilitation tax credit, limit credit amounts, and require regional distributive balance and economic effects to be considered, to modify the definition of an air quality facility, to create minority outreach requirements for loan and grant programs established under this bill, and to make an appropriation.

553.title: Workers' Compensation-interstate claims
553.description: To amend sections 4123.01, 4123.26, 4123.29, 4123.54, and 4123.82 and to enact sections 4123.292, 4123.513, and 4123.542 to prohibit an employee from receiving workers' compensation benefits in this state if the employee has received a decision on the merits of a claim filed in another state for the same injury or occupational disease, to allow an Ohio employer to obtain, through the Administrator of Workers' Compensation or an insurance company, workers' compensation insurance for claims arising in other states, and to make other changes to the Workers' Compensation Law regarding interstate workers' compensation claims.

554.title: Health insurance-cover colorectal exams/cancer lab tests
554.description: To enact sections 1751.69, 3923.651, and 5111.017 of the Revised Code to require certain health care policies, contracts, agreements, and plans, as well as the state's Medicaid program, to provide benefits for colorectal examinations and laboratory tests for cancer.

555.title: Fibromyalgia Awareness Month-January
555.description: To enact section 5.2239 of the Revised Code to designate January as "Fibromyalgia Awareness Month."

556.last_action: To Financial Institutions, Real Estate, & Securities
556.title: Board of elections members-increase salary/buy additional PERS service credit
556.description: To amend sections 145.201, 145.58, and 3501.12 of the Revised Code to increase the salary paid to members of boards of elections and to allow members of boards of elections to purchase additional service credit in the Public Employees Retirement System.

557.title: Interstate gas pipeline easements-tree and structure removals
557.description: To enact section 4933.41 of the Revised Code relative to the removal of trees and structures from easements that are part of interstate gas pipeline facilities.

558.title: Compassionate Assistance for Rape Emergencies Act
558.description: To enact sections 2907.12, 3727.50, 3727.501, and 3727.502, of the Revised Code to establish the Compassionate Assistance for Rape Emergencies Act regarding emergency services provided to victims of sexual assault.

559.title: Health insurance-cover contraceptive drugs and devices
559.description: To enact sections 1751.661 and 3923.602 of the Revised Code to prohibit certain sickness and accident insurance policies, public employee benefit plans, and health insuring corporation policies, contracts, and agreements from limiting or excluding coverage for prescription contraceptive drugs and devices and outpatient services related to the provision of such drugs and devices.

561.last_action: To Local and Municipal Government & Urban Revitalization
561.title: Amateur radio antennae-federal restrictions on local zoning
561.description: To enact sections 303.213, 519.213, and 713.081 of the Revised Code to codify federal restrictions on local zoning of the antenna structures of amateur radio stations and place the burden of proof for compliance on the zoning authority.

562.title: Probate courts-increase fees
562.description: To amend section 2101.16, 2101.162, 2101.17, 2111.51, 2113.031, and 2303.201 of the Revised Code to increase certain fees charged by the probate court.

563.title: Boards of health-bedbug control policies
563.description: To enact section 3707.012 of the Revised Code to require boards of health to adopt vermin control policies under which bedbug infestations are treated to the same extent as other infestations.

564.title: Firearms laws/concealed carry-remove laws regarding statewide effect
564.description: To repeal section 9.68 of the Revised Code and Section 9 of Am. Sub. H.B. 12 of the 125th General Assembly to remove provisions regarding the statewide effect of state firearms laws and the Concealed Carry Licensing Law.

565.title: Liquor Control Commission-hold hearings in county seat of county where subject is
565.description: To amend section 4301.04 of the Revised Code to require that certain hearings of the Liquor Control Commission be held in the county seat of the county where the premises that is the subject of the hearing is located.

566.title: Pit bulls-prohibit
566.description: To amend section 955.11 and to enact section 955.111 of the Revised Code to prohibit the owning, keeping, or harboring of pit bull dogs beginning ninety days after the effective date of the act and to require specified officers to seize all pit bull dogs after that date.

567.last_action: To Infrastructure, Homeland Security & Veterans Affairs
567.title: Motor vehicle sound systems-prohibit operation if audible at distance
567.description: To enact section 4511.86 of the Revised Code to prohibit generally the operation of a sound device or system of devices in or on a motor vehicle if the sound is clearly audible to a person who possesses normal hearing at a distance greater than 75 feet from any part of the motor vehicle.

568.title: Hypodermic syringes-permit access-person under 18-avoid HIV exposure
568.description: To amend sections 2923.24, 2925.12, 2925.14, and 3719.172 of the Revised Code to provide an affirmative defense to certain offenses involving a hypodermic or syringe that the person is 18 years of age or older and possesses or otherwise obtains the hypodermic or syringe for the purpose of having a clean needle to avoid HIV exposure and to permit an authorized person to sell or furnish a hypodermic without a prescription to a person who is 18 years of age or older and who wishes to obtain it for that purpose.

569.title: Certificate of Need-restore program
569.description: To amend sections 3702.51, 3702.511, and 3702.52 of the Revised Code to restore the Certificate of Need Program for the construction of new hospitals and the conduct of other health-related activities.

570.title: Center for Tobacco Use Prevention/funding
570.description: To amend sections 3701.84, 5743.51, 5743.62, and 5743.63 and to enact section 5743.511 of the Revised Code to create the Center for Tobacco Use Prevention in the Department of Health to exercise duties of the former Tobacco Use Prevention and Control Foundation that were transferred to the Department, and to fund the Center's operations with an increased rate of tax on noncigarette tobacco products.

571.title: "Epilepsy Awareness Month"- November
571.description: To enact section 5.2239 of the Revised Code to designate November as "Epilepsy Awareness Month."

572.last_action: To Financial Institutions, Real Estate, & Securities
572.title: State retirement incentive plans-analyze proposed/restrict re-employment
572.description: To amend sections 145.297, 145.298, and 145.38 of the Revised Code to require an analysis of each proposed retirement incentive plan for state retirement system members and to prohibit a person who participates in such a retirement incentive plan from being re-employed by the same employer.

573.title: Sales tax-exempt massage therapy provided by licensed massotherapist
573.description: To amend section 5739.01 of the Revised Code to exempt from the sales tax massage therapy that is provided by an individual who holds a certificate to practice massage therapy.

574.title: Inspector General Act-expand and revise
574.description: To amend sections 121.41, 121.48, and 121.49 of the Revised Code to expand and revise the Inspector General Act.

575.title: Health insurance-cover thimerosal-free influenza vaccine for those under six
575.description: To enact sections 1751.661 and 3923.602 of the Revised Code to require insurers that provide coverage for the influenza vaccine to cover a thimerosal-free influenza vaccine for children under six years of age.

576.last_action: To Financial Institutions, Real Estate, & Securities
576.title: Accountant-client testimonial privilege-create
576.description: To amend section 2317.02 of the Revised Code to create an accountant-client testimonial privilege.

577.title: Juneteenth National Freedom Day-June 19
577.description: To enact section 5.2241 of the Revised Code to designate June 19 as "Juneteenth National Freedom Day."

579.title: Thermal system insulation & firestop contractors-license
579.description: To amend sections 4740.01, 4740.02, 4740.04, and 4740.12 of the Revised Code to require thermal system insulation and firestop contractors to obtain a license from the Ohio construction industry licensing board.

580.title: Vehicle Parks Act-fair operator licensees-exempt during fair
580.description: To amend section 3729.05 of the Revised Code to exempt specified persons who operate a fair and hold a license issued under the Vehicle Parks Law from complying with the requirements of that license during the time period when the preparation for, operation of, and dismantling of the fair occurs.

581.title: Oil & gas well drilling-permit requirements
581.description: To amend section 1509.06 and to enact section 1509.073 of the Revised Code to establish certain notification and noise requirements for the drilling of an oil or gas well and to authorize the Chief of the Division of Mineral Resources Management in the Department of Natural Resources to deny a permit for the drilling of an oil or gas well based on past violations of the Oil and Gas Law by the permit applicant.

582.title: Oil & gas well drilling-permitting; consider local comments on safety
582.description: To amend section 1509.06 and to enact sections 1509.062, 1509.063, and 1509.073 of the Revised Code to allow the applicable board of township trustees or legislative authority of a municipal corporation where an existing or proposed oil or gas well is or is to be located to submit written comments specifically describing safety issues regarding the well to the Chief of the Division of Mineral Resources Management in the Department of Natural Resources, to require the Chief to review any such comments before determining whether to issue a permit for the well, to establish certain notification and noise requirements for the drilling of an oil or gas well, and to establish other permit requirements.

583.title: Unsafe children's products-prohibit sale/dealer duties
583.description: To enact sections 3755.01, 3755.02, 3755.03, 3755.04, 3755.05, 3755.06, 3755.07, and 3755.08 of the Revised Code to prohibit the sale of unsafe children's products and to require commercial dealers and retailers to take specific actions in respect to unsafe children's products they have sold or are selling.

584.title: Environmental fines-paid by subdivisions-spend in county where incurred
584.description: To enact section 3745.25 of the Revised Code to require the proceeds of fines paid by certain political subdivisions under environmental laws to be expended by the state in the county that incurred the fine or in which the political subdivision that incurred the fine is located.

585.title: Art therapists-certify
585.description: To enact sections 4757.50 to 4757.64 of the Revised Code to provide for art therapist certificates.

586.title: Melanoma/Skin Cancer Detection & Prevention Month-May
586.description: To enact section 5.2239 of the Revised Code to designate May as "Melanoma/Skin Cancer Detection and Prevention Month."

587.title: To revise the membership of the transportation review advisory council.
587.description: To amend sections 5512.05, 5512.07, and 5512.08 of the Revised Code to revise the membership of the transportation review advisory council.

588.title: Bed Bug Awareness, Education, & Prevention Program
588.description: To enact sections 3701.136, 3701.137, 3701.138, and 3701.139 of the Revised Code to establish the Bed Bug Awareness, Education, and Prevention Program and to make an appropriation.

589.title: Oil & gas well drilling permits-add notice & meeting requirements
589.description: To amend sections 1509.06, 1509.072, and 1509.31 of the Revised Code to establish additional public notice and public meeting requirements concerning applications for certain permits for oil or gas wells.

590.title: Smoking ban-exempt stand-alone bars
590.description: To amend sections 3794.01 and 3794.03 of the Revised Code to exempt stand-alone bars from the smoking ban.

591.title: Operate motorcycle without proper license or endorsement-clarify penalties
591.description: To amend section 4510.12 of the Revised Code to clarify the penalties for operating a motorcycle without having either a motorcycle endorsement or the proper restricted license.

592.title: Motor fuel tax-moratorium
592.description: To provide a 90-day moratorium on the state motor fuel tax.

593.title: Medicaid-seek approval-alcohol/controlled substance testing/treatment component
593.description: To enact section 5111.0119 of the Revised Code to require the Director of Job and Family Services to seek federal approval to establish an alcohol and controlled substance testing and treatment component of the Medicaid program.
